Class MerkleHellman

  • java.lang.Object
    • MerkleHellman

  • public class MerkleHellman
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to generate key values for Merkle-Hellman Knapsack Cryptosystem
    Author:
    Ru Zhao

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MerkleHellman(int n)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.math.BigInteger[] calculatePublicKey(java.math.BigInteger q, java.math.BigInteger r)
      calculate public key list Precondition: The array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList(), q and r is already created by generateQ() and generateR(), as the inputs Postcondition: public key list is generated and returned Best case Big Theta: n Worst case Big Theta: n
      java.math.BigInteger generatePrivateKeyList()
      Generate private key list, which is "w" Postcondition: the array containing bigintegers is generated, sum is returned Best case Big Theta: n Worst case Big Theta: n
      java.math.BigInteger generateQ(java.math.BigInteger sum)
      Generate "q" Precondition: The array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList(), sum is the sum of elements in "w" Postcondition: q is generated and returned Best case Big Theta: 1 Worst case Big Theta: 1
      java.math.BigInteger generateR(java.math.BigInteger q)
      generate "r" Precondition: The array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList(), q which is the input is already created by generateQ() Postcondition: r is generated and returned Best case Big Theta: 1 Worst case Big Theta: unlimited (random number generater cannot be controlled)
      java.math.BigInteger[] getArray()
      Get the array of "w" Precondition: This array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList() Postcondition: the array containing bigintegers is returned Best case Big Theta: 1 Worst case Big Theta: 1

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public MerkleHellman(int n)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        n - number of nodes inside the array

    • Method Detail

      • getArray

        public java.math.BigInteger[] getArray()
        Get the array of "w" Precondition: This array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList() Postcondition: the array containing bigintegers is returned Best case Big Theta: 1 Worst case Big Theta: 1
        Returns:
        the array of this Cryptosystem, which is "w"

      • generatePrivateKeyList

        public java.math.BigInteger generatePrivateKeyList()
        Generate private key list, which is "w" Postcondition: the array containing bigintegers is generated, sum is returned Best case Big Theta: n Worst case Big Theta: n
        Parameters:
        n - number of nodes in the list
        Returns:
        sum of the list "w"

      • generateQ

        public java.math.BigInteger generateQ(java.math.BigInteger sum)
        Generate "q" Precondition: The array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList(), sum is the sum of elements in "w" Postcondition: q is generated and returned Best case Big Theta: 1 Worst case Big Theta: 1
        Parameters:
        sum - sum of the list "w"
        Returns:
        q

      • generateR

        public java.math.BigInteger generateR(java.math.BigInteger q)
        generate "r" Precondition: The array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList(), q which is the input is already created by generateQ() Postcondition: r is generated and returned Best case Big Theta: 1 Worst case Big Theta: unlimited (random number generater cannot be controlled)
        Parameters:
        q - q of this Cryptosystem
        Returns:
        r

      • calculatePublicKey

        public java.math.BigInteger[] calculatePublicKey(java.math.BigInteger q,
                                                 java.math.BigInteger r)
        calculate public key list Precondition: The array is already initialized by generatePrivateKeyList(), q and r is already created by generateQ() and generateR(), as the inputs Postcondition: public key list is generated and returned Best case Big Theta: n Worst case Big Theta: n
        Parameters:
        q - q of this Cryptosystem
        r - r of this Cryptosystem
        Returns:
        public key list
